Introduction

The package SpectralVis provides a comprehensive set of tools and data for spectral based calculations:

Large real life spectral datasets

  • 3 sets of MacBeth color checker spectra
  • Mars Exploration Rover (MER) related datasets, like
    • spectrum of the Martian sky, as measured by the Opportunity rover
    • all MER PanCam filter spectra (IR-Vis)
    • all MER calibration target (Caltarget) spectra (IR-Vis)
  • a complete spectral AgfaIt872 dataset
  • complete Munsell matte spectral dataset
  • a complete spectral set of the Kodak Wratten filters
  • several measured mineral spectra
  • Vantablack® reflectance spectrum (IR-Vis)

Distinct spectral types

  • illuminant spectra (::LSpec)
  • reflectance spectra (::RSpec)
  • transmittance spectra (::TSpec)
  • multispectral types
    • a wide variety of CIE CMFs (::CMatch)
    • and the cone fundamentals that come with these (::ConeFund)
    • conversion methods

Spectral environments for the automation of adapting spectra to the same spectral configurations

Chromatic adaptation transforms (CATs)/cone response matrices

  • XYZ scaling
  • vonKries
  • linearized Bradford transform
  • Sharp transform
  • Fairchild transform
  • CAT97s
  • CAT02
  • Hunter-Pointer-Estevez transform
  • Süsstrunk transform
  • Ingling-Tsou suprathreshold trasforma (color opponent space)

Spectral generators

  • block spectra
  • blackbody generator
  • CIE Daylight series generator
  • all 12 CIE F-series illuminant spectra
  • CIE A, B, C illuminant spectra
  • LED illuminant generator
  • 7 Gas discharge illuminant spectra
    • Low pressure sodium
    • High pressure sodium
    • High pressure mercury
    • High pressure mercury with red-emitting phosphor coating
    • High pressure mercury with red-emitting phopsphor coating and tungsten filament ballast
    • High pressure mercury with metal halides
    • Xenon
  • sinusoidal SPD generator

Jozef Cohen’s matrix-R methods

  • fundamental metamers
  • metameric blacks
  • metamer generation
  • a comprehensive set of methods for spectral interactions of all types mentioned above

A large collection of color-matching ellipse datasets

  • PGN: P. G. Nutting Jr. (the most famous ellispe dataset)
  • DLM: David L. MacAdam
  • WRB: W. R. J. Brown (after Brown & MacAdam)
  • GW: 42 years old observer
  • AR: 27 years old observer
  • GF: 32 years old observer
  • 12B: Average ellipses of W. R. J. Brown’s group of 12 observers
  • FMC: predicted ellipses by the Friele-MacAdam-Chickering formula optimized for best fit with PGN ellipses.

State of the art spectral simulation of color deficiencies, including genetically caused shifts of cone response curves

  • protanopia
  • deuteranopia
  • tritanopia
  • protanomaly
  • deuteranomaly
  • tritanomaly

Gamuts

  • gamut visualization methods
